A.strategy: Start with lots of colour covering the grid, then reduce intensity and bring it back up to full coverage
A.interference_notes: Clear relationship between the audio and visuals

B.strategy: understand how I can use the tool to create sound textures. play around with parameters and embrace randomness to achieve something cohesive
B.expectations_vs_outcome: The lights followed the musical motif as expected. As I could not see the the outcome when composing I tried to produce something musical instead of visual.

C.strategy: play around with the the sounds and visuals to bring together what I have learnt during the experiment. focus was to bring as much variety to the final session
C.expectations_vs_outcome:
I initially found this task less satisfying than my first two attempts. I think this is because while I have a basic understanding of the system, different parameters seeem to feed into the same outcome unless rules are followed. 

Despite this I really enjoyed the final playback as there were lots of interesting audio and visual outputs which were partially planned but also unexpected.
C.interference_notes: the middle section of the track didnt change much despite me playing around with a lot of parameters, after this by chance I stumbled accross a really interesting motiff which I was really pleased with

one_change: Incorporate A/D/S/R envelopes into the audio and visuals!
reflection:
Creativity can come from not fully understanding the parameters and playing around
Musical knowledge and theory is not required to make music and enjoy the creative process
Using the system I felt like I was experiencing audio and visual as a combined sense opposed to sensing them separately.
session_notes_transcription: loop on/off button not clear; much prefered the final outcome
